scenarios.title: Low Descovy share with missed PrEP opportunity
scenarios.summary: Decile 3 IM prescriber underutilizes PrEP despite steady STI testing in young MSM; inconsistent quarterly labs and follow-ups.
scenarios.objection: Clinic believes few true PrEP candidates; renal safety and monitoring workload concerns.
scenarios.goal: Create urgency around PrEP gaps; commit to proactive Descovy prescribing where appropriate and standardize quarterly follow-ups.
scenarios.approach: Quantify risk pool from STI volume, review renal safety data, and propose nurse-led PrEP/lab cadence.

scenarios.title: High Descovy share but access and staffing barriers
scenarios.summary: Decile 10 NP with strong share; prior-auth workload and workflow friction limit breadth of appropriate prescribing.
scenarios.goal: Broaden appropriate Descovy use via predictable PA batching and support roles; revisit generic TDF users with unrestricted coverage.
scenarios.approach: Implement twice-weekly PA batching with pharmacy partner and benefits checks.

scenarios.title: Slowing Biktarvy switches in stable patients
scenarios.summary: Top HIV clinic; prior switch velocity fell to 1–2 in 13 weeks; perception that most patients are optimized.
scenarios.goal: Reinforce durability and convenience; define clear switch criteria and run quarterly optimization review.
scenarios.approach: Create candidate list by labs/adherence flags; schedule switch day with counseling script.

scenarios.title: Favoring cabotegravir/rilpivirine without uniform screening
scenarios.summary: CAB share growing; NP often honors requests without systematic adherence/resistance evaluation.
scenarios.objection: Patient demand driving selection; uncertainty about resistance and monitoring.
scenarios.goal: Align on candidacy and monitoring criteria; protect long-term regimen durability.
scenarios.approach: Adopt checklist for eligibility, resistance history, and missed-dose plan; schedule injection calendar.

scenarios.title: Low Apretude vs TDF/FTC and Descovy
scenarios.summary: PrEP mix skewed to orals; PA backlog; missing standing lab protocol; misconceptions about long-acting adherence.
scenarios.objection: Belief that long-acting requires near-perfect adherence; operational friction.
scenarios.goal: Offer Apretude to adherence-challenged candidates and convert high-risk TDF/FTC users with renal risk to Descovy where access allows.
scenarios.approach: Nurse-led lab/injection calendar and PA batching; education on initiation and follow-up cadence.

scenarios.title: Strong PrEP program but operationally capped
scenarios.summary: FQHC with high demand; PA burden caps TAF/Apretude; ad-hoc pharmacy engagement.
scenarios.goal: Batch PAs with pharmacy tech support; monthly Apretude start day; default naive high-risk starts appropriately.
scenarios.approach: Standing process for benefits checks and clinic event template.

scenarios.title: Treatment optimization day for switches
scenarios.summary: Hospital-affiliated ID clinic; few recent switches; CAB/RPV interest among adherent younger patients.
scenarios.objection: Perception of optimization; uncertainty on candidacy.
scenarios.goal: Define CAB/RPV candidacy and counseling; track suppression and missed-dose events.
scenarios.approach: Quarterly optimization clinic with resistance review and tracking.

scenarios.title: IO-backbone heavy; ADC toxicity bandwidth
scenarios.summary: Solid-tumor center evaluating ADCs; P&T scrutinizes cost/response and chair time; toxicity bandwidth is constraint.
scenarios.objection: Toxicity management resources and pathway integration.
scenarios.goal: Define biomarker-driven subset with ΔOS/ΔPFS and operational fit; add to order sets/tumor board.
scenarios.approach: Present subset data and AE mitigation plan; align with NCCN category of evidence.

scenarios.title: Pathway-driven care with staffing constraints
scenarios.summary: Community infusion site; conservative IO use; AE clinics short-staffed; education packets inconsistent.
scenarios.goal: Standardize NP-led education and toxicity call-tree; add AE one-pager to pathway handouts.
scenarios.approach: Template kits and standing nurse protocols.

scenarios.title: Oral oncolytic onboarding at T-7
scenarios.summary: GU team struggles with hub forms and day-25–30 refill gaps.
scenarios.objection: Fragmented onboarding and late hub enrollment.
scenarios.goal: Adopt T-7 onboarding with early hub, benefits check, and day-10 toxicity tele-visit.

scenarios.title: Adult flu program underperforming
scenarios.summary: ID group with LTC/high-risk adults; late clinic launches; weak reminder-recall; coverage fell in 65+.
scenarios.objection: Scheduling and outreach gaps; denials in 65+ formulations.
scenarios.goal: Pre-book age-appropriate mix; schedule early clinics; SMS reminders; standing orders in LTC.
scenarios.approach: Calendarized clinic days and EHR prompts for 65+ high-dose/adjuvanted selection.

scenarios.title: Primary care capture with fragmented workflows
scenarios.summary: Adequate storage; VIS misses due to staff rotation; ad-hoc Saturday clinics.
scenarios.goal: Standing orders, huddle checklists, and fixed weekend clinics.
scenarios.approach: EHR prompts and standardized VIS documentation.

scenarios.title: Employer and college outreach alignment
scenarios.summary: High uptake in HCWs, low in students; inventory turns slow due to late campus events.
scenarios.objection: Late campus scheduling and inventory drag.
scenarios.goal: Campus pop-ups tied to orientation/midterms; redistribute excess to employer sites by week 6.

scenarios.title: Outpatient antivirals under-utilized
scenarios.summary: High-risk COPD/ILD population; Paxlovid first line; 3-day IV remdesivir limited by capacity; DDI triage slows prescribing.
scenarios.goal: Rapid DDI triage and standing infusion slot; 48-hour initiation KPI.
scenarios.approach: Protocol for DDI screen and partner infusion scheduling.

scenarios.title: Post-COVID clinic adherence issues
scenarios.summary: Eligible patients present day 4–5; callbacks delay start; variable education on rebound.
scenarios.goal: Same-day eRx template; patient one-pager; route day-2 positives to NP tele-start.

scenarios.title: Hospital-at-home linkage for antivirals
scenarios.summary: Discharges qualify for outpatient therapy but lack transport for IV remdesivir; home-infusion underused.
scenarios.goal: Default home-infusion referral for remdesivir day 1–3 when Paxlovid contraindicated; track 7-day readmissions.
scenarios.approach: Discharge checklist and vendor referral workflow.

scenarios.title: HFrEF clinic with uneven GDMT adoption
scenarios.summary: Entresto uptake 62% of eligible HFrEF; SGLT2 at 38%; fellows handle PAs; day-30 refill gaps.
scenarios.objection: Copays, PA friction, and handoffs to PCP.
scenarios.goal: Discharge GDMT checklist; pharmacy tech enrollment for copay help; +10pp SGLT2 in 90 days and halve 30-day gaps.
scenarios.approach: Start SGLT2 before discharge when eligible; convert ACE/ARB to ARNI within 48–72h per protocol.

scenarios.title: Rural HF program with renal concerns
scenarios.summary: SGLT2 underused in CKD stage 3 due to misconceptions; no titration calendar.
scenarios.objection: CKD safety misconceptions and calendar gaps.
scenarios.goal: Implement titration calendar and CKD-safe counseling; track eGFR and UACR at baseline and 12 weeks.
scenarios.approach: Standardize initiation with sick-day rules and follow-up labs.

scenarios.title: Post-MI and HF transitions program
scenarios.summary: SGLT2 initiation often deferred to PCP; ARNI starts delayed pending echo; readmissions above benchmark.
scenarios.goal: Start SGLT2 prior to discharge and convert to ARNI within 48–72h; pharmacy follow-up day 7.
